nodes.bodyText: is HDP3 an important thing here?

We have iceberg.properties in Hadoop, so this is not "some iceberg", it's "iceberg with Spark".
What about SinglenodeSparkIceberg ?
it's baked into the container.. maybe should be removed from the dockerfile?

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -30,6 +30,11 @@ presto-product-tests-launcher/bin/run-launcher test run \
     -- -g sqlserver \
     || suite_exit_code=1
 
+presto-product-tests-launcher/bin/run-launcher test run \
+    --environment singlenode-iceberg \
+    -- -g iceberg -x storage_formats \

nodes.bodyText:
use 2 space ident for consistency with the rest of the file
(we can change in separate commit/pr)

@@ -123,6 +123,19 @@ databases:
     jdbc_pooling: true
     table_manager_type: jdbc
 
+  spark:
+      host: spark
+      jdbc_driver_class: org.apache.hive.jdbc.HiveDriver
+      jdbc_url: jdbc:hive2://${databases.spark.host}:10213
+      jdbc_user: hive
+      jdbc_password: na
+      jdbc_pooling: false
+      schema: default
+      prepare_statement:
+          - USE ${databases.spark.schema}
+      table_manager_type: jdbc
+      warehouse_directory_path: /user/hive/warehouse
